RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 26 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIDNIGHT FLING settled off the early pace outside, bid leaving the three eighths pole and steadily improved, rounded the turn about the three path, dug in from the head of the lane to take over later yards and raced clear under the wire. RED PRIESTESS dueled for the lead and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn at the rail, was steadily handled leaving the turn but gave up the lead in the final yards. SUPERSNAKE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and came along to take third nearing mid-stretch. ULTIMATE BREEZE chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then eased out toward the head of the lane and finished well to close the gap. JESS FOR KICKS pressured the early pace but flattened stride at the rail on the turn. VEGAS SLIPPERS popped the gate open pre-break, was through early and raced wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Ultimate Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,finished well,closed gap

ENTRY.NAME: Red Priestess
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,caught final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Fling
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace outside,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up late,clear wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JALEBI BABY rated close toward the inside, took over leaving the seven sixteenths pole and came under pressure past the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on well. DYLADDIE stalked the early pace from the three and four paths, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and raced two deep on the far turn, couldn't gain on the winner and settled for second. I B NASTY saved ground off the pace, bid approaching the three eighths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn, dug in through the stretch and took third late yards. WALK A FINE LINE stalked the early pace off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. SUPERSTASIA raced off the pace in the three path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. EXCUSES EXCUSES became a bit anxious in the gate then closed to the front toward the three quarter pole, was caught past the seven sixteenths, gave brief chase from that point but faded past the five sixteenths. Per Stewards ruling #29, Jalebi Baby has been disqualified from earnings.

ENTRY.NAME: I B Nasty
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,3p far turn,up 3rd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Jalebi Baby
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,up past 7/16,pressured 5/16,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Walk a Fine Line
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened inside 1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 46. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MARCHED tapered in and took over toward the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, was steadily handled to mid-stretch then coasted the final sixteenth. S S SPARTAN ENERGY became very fractious and sat down in the gate, entered the first turn in the five path, gave chase leaving the half mile pole and steadily improved, rounded the far turn off the rail but had to settle for second best. CRISTIANO BOY saved ground, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and came along for third later yards. ROCKET BALLAD raced well back in the four path the first turn, started a bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. MONKEY WRENCH stalked the early pace inside, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. BOBBYS CASE LOAD saved ground on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the stretch. ALLEGHENY HERO settled back in the three and four paths the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but faded into the far turn. WATCHING SNOW FLY tapered in and stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase from the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. CHARTERED COURSE saved ground, was eased on the first turn but walked off post race. Comeonturnmeloose became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Cristiano Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 3/8,3p far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: S S Spartan Energy
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious,sat in gate,5p early,chased 1/2,off rail turn,settle2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Marched
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,coasted final 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Le ss Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRINCE OF FENTON took a quick early lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. FEARNOUGHT stalked the early pace inside, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, dug in through the stretch and held on for second. STORMIN ROCKET rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced three wide on the far turn and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. DANCIN IN DUBAI stalked off the rail, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn two deep then flattened inside the eighth pole. NO ME DIGAS rounded the first turn in the five path, gave chase from the three eighth pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. MAKE THE WAY CLEAR settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch and raced in the five path of the far turn. LIGHTNING LAD rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the three eighths pole then flattened at the rail approaching the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,bid 7/16,rail far turn,dug in lane,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Prince of Fenton
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 1/4,rail turn,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,2d far turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LUCKY BOP closed to the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn and held on well under steady stretch handling. LOVE OF GRACE chased the pace through the backstretch, came in a path or two nearing the quarter pole and raced close on the turn, dug in leaving the turn and finished well to take second in the final stride. POLISH THE DIAMOND chased through the backstretch and raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dug in from the head of the lane but was nipped from second the final stride. SMOKIN LADY chased inside, raced close at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CANDY LOVES HONEY chased the pace toward the inside, pulled herself to the heels of Love Of Grace midway on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. CARMELIZED gave chase then faded nearing the turn. VAN HOOK chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, drifted leaving the turn and weakened. LET'S DO THIS chased the pace inside, steadied at the inside flank of Love Of Grace into the turn and weakened. ONLY ROMANCE gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path. SNEAKY LYNK saved ground. A Stewards inquiry resulted in the disqualification of Love Of Grace to seventh place for impeding the progress of Let's Do This entering the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin Lady
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Bop
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 1/2,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Candy Loves Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rank on heels mid turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Love of Grace
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,moved in into turn,dug in lane,up 2nd wire

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Dece mber 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 26 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOZY'S WILDCAT rated the pace inside, came under pressure past the five sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was kept alert in the lane. ALPHA CHI RHO rounded the first turn about the five path, entered the backstretch outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved in the four path of the far turn then dug in from the head of the lane and dueled through later yards for second. TRINGALE stalked off the rail, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, then outfinished for second in later yards. MR HOOVER saved early ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. MOTAGALLY saved ground on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. ROCKET APPEAL stalked three wide on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened. BOMBOLONI rated close inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole then weakened at the rail on the far turn. LET US MAKE GOLD raced well back saving ground. RACE ORIGINALLY HAND-TIMED, TIMES CHANGED UPON REVIEW.

ENTRY.NAME: Motagally
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 1/2,chased 3/8,3p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Kozy's Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured past 5/16,rail far turn,kept alert

ENTRY.NAME: Bomboloni
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Hoover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Truett Wilbur

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 26 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 26 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SARGENT KOBE stalked the early pace off the rail, took the lead nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was kept sharp in the lane. ACASHA'S INTUITION rated off the pace inside, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn near the rail, angled to the five path leaving the turn and dug in to take second the final strides. LEG UP rounded the first turn in the three path then stalked into the backstretch, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened stride late yards. TIMMY raced in the four path the opening turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, ran in the three path of the far turn and flattened in the lane. RED HOT TODDY saved early ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, altered course to come between horses mid-stretch but showed little more. TALKING TEDDY cleared the field and angled to the inside to set the pace, came under pressure nearing the seven sixteenths pole and dueled at even terms from that point, but was met approaching the three eighths pole and faded at the rail into the far turn. ROCKET'S CASTLE settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response.

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,up near 3/8,rail turn,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: Leg Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 9700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 26, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 26, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOMMY SHELBY raced close four wide through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead three wide toward the five sixteenths, drew off at the rail on the turn and was geared down to win handily in spite of throwing a shoe mid-stretch. FINAL SAY raced off the early pace in the three and four paths, gave chase from the nine sixteenths pole, ran at the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. SUNMAN raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, steadily improved and raced off the rail on the far turn, eased out toward the head of the lane then lugged in and finished evenly for third inside the sixteenth pole. FORT FORTITUDE settled toward the inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn four wide then flattened stride. PENNSYLVANIA STEEL rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole but was caught toward the five sixteenths, dropped back approaching the quarter pole and flattened off the rail on the far turn. MEGA MILLIONS broke in the air then saved ground racing well back, could only improve his position and rounded the far turn about the three path. UNIDENTIFIED MAN raced with the early pace three wide and between horses then stalked into the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back at the five sixteenths and weakened midway on the far turn. ELLIE'S LIL MAN raced with the early pace two deep while between horses then stalked into the first turn, gave chase from the half mile pole but faded through the backstretch. PANSTER bore out into the first turn, left the turn outside and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Pennsylvania Steel
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 7/16,met near 5/16,flattened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sunman
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,lugged in,evenly 3rd

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Country Life Farm & Moon Map Broodmare LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mega Millions
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in the air,saved early ground,improved position,3p far turn
